description: Financial technology, payments, and PCI-DSS regulated applications

questions.question: What PCI-DSS compliance level is required (1-4)?
questions.why: Level 1 requires annual on-site audit; lower levels have different assessment requirements

questions.question: Will the system store, process, or transmit cardholder data?
questions.why: Determines if PCI-DSS scope applies; tokenization can reduce scope significantly

questions.question: Should card data be tokenized? Using which provider?
questions.why: Tokenization (Stripe, Braintree, Adyen) dramatically reduces PCI compliance scope

questions.question: What fraud detection capabilities are needed?
questions.why: Real-time vs batch, ML-based vs rules-based affects architecture significantly

questions.question: What payment methods must be supported?
questions.why: Each gateway has different integration patterns and capabilities

questions.question: What reconciliation and settlement processes are needed?
questions.why: Determines batch job requirements, reporting, and accounting integrations

questions.question: Are there anti-money laundering (AML) requirements?
questions.why: KYC, transaction monitoring, and suspicious activity reporting may be required

questions.question: What chargeback and dispute handling is required?
questions.why: Affects transaction state machine and evidence retention policies

questions.question: Is this subject to state money transmitter licensing?
questions.why: Holding funds may require licensing in each US state

questions.question: What currencies and international payment support is needed?
questions.why: Multi-currency adds complexity in pricing, settlement, and compliance
